title: D Major Scale
description: Learn the D major scale with two sharps — F# and C#.

steps.title: D Major — Two Sharps
steps.description: The D major scale has two sharps: F# and C#. The notes are D, E, F#, G, A, B, C#. Each new major scale in the 'sharp direction' adds one more sharp. G major had F#; D major adds C#.

steps.title: Find D
steps.description: Press D4. D is the white key between the two black keys.

steps.title: Find C# and F#
steps.description: Press C#4 and F#4 together — the two sharps in D major.
steps.hint: C#4 is MIDI 61 (black key right of C), F#4 is MIDI 66 (black key right of F).

steps.title: Play the D Major Scale
steps.description: Play all 7 notes ascending: D, E, F#, G, A, B, C#.
steps.hint: Start on D, play white keys but use F# and C# (the black keys) instead of F and C.

steps.title: Play D Major Chord
steps.description: Play D, F#, and A together to form the D major chord.

steps.title: D Major Quiz
steps.description: How many sharps does the D major scale have?
